cohort.reelThemIn: Happiness is your last exam paper
Life is short, the art is long
cohort.bio: I have recently switched paths from engineering to data analytics after noticing my niche and what I liked. I decided upon data analytics because I love being creative with technology and exercising logical thinking. During my free time, I like to support my local soccer teams or hang out with my cat.

cohort.reelThemIn: Do now what others wont so you can do tomorrow what others can't.
cohort.bio: I'm a multifaceted individual with seven years of experience analyzing and troubleshooting in the field; two of which were focused on automated robotic systems in pharmacy and lab settings. I first got into data analytics when I worked in a Covid testing lab. Seeing the results of each patient and the overall trend of cases was awe-inspiring and encouraged me to learn SQL. After getting a grasp on SQL, I got a job working directly with databases and linking them to servers using a variety of interfaces. I'm hoping to transition into a field where I can visualize trends and help the world make better-informed decisions. When I'm not in front of a computer, you can find me on the disc golf course.

cohort.reelThemIn: Remain true to the earth
cohort.bio: Internal auditor and finance specialist turned data analyst, my innate curiosity and love of learning make me fearless when it comes to tackling complex problems. I believe that data analytics is an immensely powerful tool to distill the story behind the data, deriving meaning and actionable insight from abstract numbers.

cohort.reelThemIn: Do something good today
cohort.bio: I was a middle school teacher and Athletic Director the past 10 years but have swtiched to data analytics.  I am fascinated with the analytic side to problem solving and love diving into data to find a solution to problems.  I am very family oriented and my wife and I have three children.

cohort.reelThemIn: "I am still learning" - Michelangelo
cohort.bio: I am a creative and detail-oriented problem solver that values learning from others and building new relationships. I come from a diverse professional background from working in library and archives. I learned I love working with data in my previous field and I decided to make a career change. I am enthusiastic about growing in my data analyst career with my new skills that Nashville Software School has equipped me with.

cohort.reelThemIn: "Let it sh*t go" - Buddha
cohort.bio: Professional with three years' experience in software development management and ERP consulting. Before that I've traveled around the world 30 month straight, and currently I'm focusing on cultivating the garden whenever I have a time to spare.

cohort.reelThemIn: Fear not for I am with you.
cohort.bio: Over a decade of experience in mortgage underwriting, analyzing, and risk mitigation. I have developed a passion for curiosity. My background in underwriting coupled with my interest to explore and make meaning of data has motivated me to pursue a career in data analytics. I look forward to new experiences within data.

cohort.reelThemIn: Little by little, one travels far. -JRR Tolkien
cohort.bio: From full-time barista & coffee roaster to full-time data analytics student, the allure of constant problem-solving & comprehending complex ideas drew me to data analytics.

cohort.reelThemIn: "I never dreamed about success. I worked for it." -Estée Lauder
cohort.bio: Program development and curriculum evaluation specialist with expertise in distance learning, out-of-schooltime programs, and youth development. Adept mixed-methods social science researcher with an emphasis on data analytics and prevention science.

cohort.reelThemIn: Onward.
cohort.bio: I'm a licensed civil engineer with 7 years of experience in traffic engineering and bridge design. I was drawn to data analytics because as our transportation systems get smarter, we continually add more sensors that are constantly collecting data. Most transportation professionals don't have the tools to churn through all the data to see what it can tell us.

cohort.reelThemIn: "I am much more powerful than any challenge."
cohort.bio: I've lived and traveled to many parts of the world mainly because my dad was in the military. And when it was my time to decide where to live, I decided on Tennessee. I went to the University of Tennessee in Knoxville and received my degree in Economics. I also met my husband there. When we graduated, we moved to Franklin, TN where we both pursued our careers in finance. During the ten years of being in that field, we welcomed a son and a daughter. When I left the finance world in 2019, I wanted to take some time to decide on what my next career path would be. Unfortunately, Covid hit six months later which put everything on hold. Three years later and things are slowly getting back to normal, it was time to invest in myself and move forward in my career as a data analyst.

cohort.reelThemIn: Worry less, smile more
Have Fun. You'll Accomplish More.
cohort.bio: Continuous learner who is quick to adapt to changes. Throughout my life, I've approached every challenge with an open mind, and a desire to achieve success. Ready to Excel in Data Analytics.

cohort.reelThemIn: The truth lies after the semicolon;  the rest is data
cohort.bio: Motivated by a direction to focus a varied background of experience in work and life into a new path of realizing quantitative insights from data-driven analysis, I plan to join organizational, visual, and creative strengths with querying, dashboarding, and geospatial skills and tell vibrant, informative stories, spark new conversations, and crossover into new opportunities, plateaus, and tableaus.

cohort.reelThemIn: It always seems impossible until it's done. -Nelson Mandela
If Harry Potter speaks parseltongue, can he code in Python?
cohort.bio: Spent the last 6 years working as a processor with a trucking company, and found that I love to learn the ins and outs of data. The who, what, when, where, and why.

cohort.reelThemIn: It 's nice to be important but it's more important to be nice.
"Always laugh when you can, it is cheap medicine" - Lord Byron
cohort.bio: I have been a Registered Nurse working primarily in the home care setting. I enjoy getting to meet people and helping them with their healthcare needs. I enjoy the outdoors and try to spend as much free time outside with my family. We enjoy traveling and visiting national parks. I am a hard worker and will always show up on time with a smile and willingness to give whatever the project is 100%.

cohort.reelThemIn: I do this for fun. Unfortunately.
cohort.bio: I've worked a hundred jobs and never had a career. However, I've always lived a data-driven approach to my life, trying to look at numbers and seeking truth that way. After spending years teaching myself, I realized this was a passion and so I selfishly enrolled in data school to learn how to make my own projects.

cohort.reelThemIn: Without music, life would b flat
cohort.bio: Data and analytics have always been a big part of my life. I love exploring, analyzing, and leveraging data to problem solve and build a story that will make an impact on both a professional and personal level. I have used data analytics most of my professional career to increase revenue, reduce waste, improve quality and drive supply chain improvements. I am thankful and grateful to Nashville Software School  for providing me extensive training in new, exciting ways to extract, transform, analyze and visualize data. I can't wait to put these new skills to work in my future career endeavors.

cohort.reelThemIn: Well begun is half done.
TANSTAAFL - There Aint No Such Thing As A Free Lunch
cohort.bio: From weather forecasting to industrial engineering, I've been working with a lot of data.  Now I'm diving deeper into data analytics enroute to becoming a future data scientist.

cohort.reelThemIn: Never Ever Give Up
cohort.bio: Highly motivated, hardworking, and detail-oriented learner with passion for learning new technology.

cohort.reelThemIn: Well done is better than well said.
cohort.bio: Hospitality professional of 15 years transitioning into analysis to further hone a new skillset while lending a well-developed set of soft skills. Critical thinker and problem solver who thrives in a team-oriented environment. Passionate about finding the connections between data to help solve complicated questions and reporting them in a digestible format.

cohort.reelThemIn: All we can do is the best we can do.
cohort.bio: I am a highly driven professional with a passion for solving complex problems. My diverse background, including hospitality and animatronics, allows me to solve problems through a creative lens. I am passionate about exploring datasets, collaboration, critical thinking while growing my skills further in a data analyst position
